news_header: The Port of Helsinki's Managing Director emphasizes consideration for endangered species amid opposition to a proposed tunnel in the Lapinlahti region, which faces political disputes and environmental concerns.
news_text: The Managing Director of the Port of Helsinki, Ville Haapasaari, assures that endangered species will be considered in the port tunnel project. There is significant opposition from local operators regarding the construction of a tunnel at Lapinlahti Park, with political disputes arising. The Greens oppose the tunnel, citing threats to endangered species and cultural environments. The project has faced administrative complaints and differing opinions on the necessity of the tunnel, with some arguing for a more western entrance to mitigate impacts. The port tunnel is deemed essential for improving transport efficiency and safety, with a projected cost of around EUR 300 million. Measures are being taken to protect local endangered species during construction.
